title: Hardwood storage box for PSA Slabs Trade od sale
author: deltaarnet

posts.post_title: Hardwood storage box for PSA Slabs Trade od sale
posts.post_content:
Wood coated with a oil mixture that brings out the deep grain found in Ash. Corners are dovetailed for strength, box holds 80 slabs at a 30 degree so the label is viable. 

 Has a russo lid support that holds the lid open. 

This was a custom box made for a member on another forum, but I took too long so he backed out and I don't blame him at all.. I'm slow at this Have a full time job as well. The inner rails are removable. I have 3 of these boxes stacked in my safe.  Asking 180.00 Shipped OBO , but really want to trade for T-206 George Brown Chicago, Tom Needham Ed Reulbuch w/glove , Jimmy Sheckard no glove. Heine Zimmerman. Cards need to be PSA 4-5. Thanks Darrell

A friendly bump to Darrell for these boxes. I've been using a knotty pine box that he made for me over 18 months ago and it has held up real nicely. The angle you can display the slabbed cards at is a great feature in my opinion
Thanks Louie!  Glad your happy with the box.  My boxes have evolved over the past year, I dovetail the joints to make the box stronger . Thanks again for the bump.

Wow. That box is absolutely fantastic! Will SGC cards work in them as well? I know the dimensions are slightly different vs PSA but it looks like there may a little bit of extra width. Not sure about height and how the depth may alter the angle you have allowed for. Love how the angled display allows the labels to be seen. Nice work!
Thanks for the kind words.  When time allows I can pull the inner rails and sand the cuts so SGC may fit. May be a bit auto OT at work right now.
Still OT at work and still looking to trade for 1908-11 cubs.  Thanks Darrell
Beauty, if only this were made to fit both PSA and SGC, you'd sell a whole bunch

[quote name="gnaz01" post=1552624]Beauty, if only this were made to fit both PSA and SGC, you'd sell a whole bunch[/QUOTE

In the works

Update on the PSA box. It is now cut for PSA and SGC. All the inner rails were cut 1/32 wider and 1/16 deeper. Now I have to re stain the cuts I did found that Minwax Classic Cherry Gel stain that matches perfect.  Hope to finish this week end and I'm still looking for t-206 Cubs for trade.

All the inner rails are stained, when cured will post pic with SGC, PSA  and some Beckett slabs as well.

As promised. Will hold Most PSA, SGC and some basic Beckett.
